channel.title: How do u make a no-ip server with vista?
channel.description: iv been at it for 2 weeks people and iv read the guide over 10 times done utube tuts and everything and yet my server isnt letting other ppl on whats the deal????

item.title: How do u make a no-ip server with vista?
item.dc:creator: @Blackened46 Blackened46
item.description:
@Blackened46 wrote:

if you have silab items on your server you wont be able to use a moparscape client only a silab client and you dont put the private ip in your serveryou put it in port forwarding section of your router if you have on [br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 06:32:03 pm[/size][hr]if you have a router then open up an internet browser and type either Http://192.168.0.1 or for some people its Http://192.168.0.0 (the first one usually works) log into your router after that has been done find port forwarding. Once you have reached this step type in the private ip address of the computer your useing if you do not know how to do this click start, ‘run’ and type cmd and click ok. in the command prompt type ipconfig and you should see an ipaddress that looks similar to ‘192.186.0.130’ the last three numbers will bedifferent than that. after you have done that enter TDC and UDP ports as 43594 if you only have one place to inter a port then put it in as 43594 and make sure the firewall for it is set to allow. this should help youwith portforwarding

Read full topic
item.source: How do u make a no-ip server with vista?

does it matter what i or other ppl use for a client like moparscape or silabscape or nah[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 06:28:25 pm[/size][hr]also what do u mean by putting the private ip of the computer on ur server???

if your server isnt letting other people on and you have a router make sure you have done port forwarding put the private ip of the computer your server is on and 43594 as the port
